snippet: A long crusade will end on Tuesday when Julia Pastrana, the “ugliest woman in the world” in 19th-century “freak” shows, is finally given a proper burial in Mexico.
abstract: Body of Julia Pastrana, 19th century woman who was put on display in sideshows across Europe, billed as the 'ugliest woman in the world,' will be given proper burial more than a century after her death; Pastrana will be taken from University of Oslo's Institute of Forensic Medicine and buried near her native town of Sinaloa, Mexico, thanks to nearly decade-long effort of artist Laura Anderson Barbata.
lead_paragraph: A long crusade will end on Tuesday when Julia Pastrana, the “ugliest woman in the world” in 19th-century “freak” shows, is finally given a proper burial in Mexico.

headline.seo: Julia Pastrana, Who Died in 1860, to Be Buried in Mexico
headline.main: An Artist Finds a Dignified Ending for an Ugly Story
headline.print_headline: An Artist Finds A Dignified Ending For an Ugly Story
